1.text: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.

2.text: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.

3.text: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.

4.text: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.

5.text: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.

6.text: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?

7.text: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.

8.text: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

9.text: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

10.text: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the LORD.

11.text: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

12.text: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.

13.text: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

14.text: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

15.text: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.

16.text: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

17.text: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

18.text: Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.

19.text: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.

20.text: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.

21.text: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.

22.text: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.

23.text: Divers weights are an abomination unto the LORD; and a false balance is not good.

24.text: Man's goings are of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?

25.text: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.

26.text: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

27.text: The spirit of man is the candle of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.

28.text: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.

29.text: The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the gray head.

30.text: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.
